content.question: A container has a piston of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and holds an ideal gas, as shown in the figure. Let <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the weight of the piston, <math alttext="F sub P " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the force the piston exerts on the gas, and <math alttext="F sub A " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the force the atmosphere exerts on the piston. Which of the following best indicates the forces on the piston?

choices.label: The figure presents a free body diagram with 2 vertical forces extending from a common point. F sub P extends upward from the point and W extends downward from the point. The lengths of the forces are the same.

The figure presents a free body diagram with 3 vertical forces extending from a common point. F sub A extends upward from the point, W and F sub P extend downward from the point. The length of F sub A is much larger than the lengths of the other forces. The length of W is slightly longer than the length of F sub P.
